Docs.summary: An encapsulation of various parameters for requesting location via LocationManager.

remarks.para: An encapsulation of various parameters for requesting location via LocationManager.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Public ReadOnly Property DurationMillis As Long
public: property long DurationMillis { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the duration for which location will be provided before the request is automatically removed.
Docs.value: the duration for which location will be provided

remarks.para: Returns the duration for which location will be provided before the request is automatically removed. A duration of Long.MAX_VALUE represents an unlimited duration.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IntervalMillis As Long
public: property long IntervalMillis { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the desired interval of location updates, or #PASSIVE_INTERVAL if this is a passive, no power request.
Docs.value: the desired interval of location updates

remarks.para: Returns the desired interval of location updates, or #PASSIVE_INTERVAL if this is a passive, no power request. A passive request will not actively generate location updates (and thus will not be power blamed for location), but may receive location updates generated as a result of other location requests. A passive request must always have an explicit minimum update interval set.
Locations may be available at a faster interval than specified here, see #getMinUpdateIntervalMillis() for the behavior in that case.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Public ReadOnly Property MaxUpdateDelayMillis As Long
public: property long MaxUpdateDelayMillis { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the maximum time any location update may be delayed, and thus grouped with following updates to enable location batching.
Docs.value: the maximum time by which a location update may be delayed

remarks.para: Returns the maximum time any location update may be delayed, and thus grouped with following updates to enable location batching. If the maximum update delay is equal to or greater than twice the interval, then location providers may provide batched results. The maximum batch size is the maximum update delay divided by the interval. Not all devices or location providers support batching, and use of this parameter does not guarantee that the client will see batched results, or that batched results will always be of the maximum size.
When available, batching can provide substantial power savings to the device, and clients are encouraged to take advantage where appropriate for the use case.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MaxUpdates As Integer
public: property int MaxUpdates { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the maximum number of location updates for this request before the request is automatically removed.

remarks.para: Returns the maximum number of location updates for this request before the request is automatically removed. A max updates value of Integer.MAX_VALUE represents an unlimited number of updates.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MinUpdateDistanceMeters As Single
public: property float MinUpdateDistanceMeters { float get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the minimum distance between location updates.
Docs.value: the minimum distance between location updates

remarks.para: Returns the minimum distance between location updates. If a potential location update is closer to the last location update than the minimum update distance, then the potential location update will not occur. A value of 0 meters implies that no location update will ever be rejected due to failing this constraint.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MinUpdateIntervalMillis As Long
public: property long MinUpdateIntervalMillis { long get(); };

remarks.para:
Returns the minimum update interval. If location updates are available faster than the request interval then locations will only be updated if the minimum update interval has expired since the last location update.

Note: Some allowance for jitter is already built into the minimum update interval, so you need not worry about updates blocked simply because they arrived a fraction of a second earlier than expected.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
Represents a passive only request. Such a request will not trigger any active locations or power usage itself, but may receive locations generated in response to other requests.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Quality As Integer
public: property int Quality { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the quality hint for this location request.
Docs.value: the desired quality tradeoffs between accuracy and power

remarks.para: Returns the quality hint for this location request. The quality hint informs the provider how it should attempt to manage any accuracy vs power tradeoffs while attempting to satisfy this location request.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: A quality constant indicating a location provider may choose to satisfy this request by equally balancing power and accuracy constraints.

remarks.para: A quality constant indicating a location provider may choose to satisfy this request by equally balancing power and accuracy constraints. Each location provider may interpret this field differently, but location providers will generally use their default behavior when this flag is present.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Locations.LocationRequestQuality QualityHighAccuracy = (100)

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Locations.LocationRequestQuality enum directly instead of this field.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("This constant will be removed in the future version. Use Android.Locations.LocationRequestQuality enum directly instead of this field.", true)>]

Docs.summary: A quality constant indicating a location provider may choose to satisfy this request by providing very accurate locations at the expense of potentially increased power usage.

remarks.para: A quality constant indicating a location provider may choose to satisfy this request by providing very accurate locations at the expense of potentially increased power usage. Each location provider may interpret this field differently, but as an example, the network provider may choose to return only wifi based locations rather than cell based locations in order to have greater accuracy when this flag is present.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.Locations.LocationRequestQuality QualityLowPower = (104)

Docs.summary: A quality constant indicating a location provider may choose to satisfy this request by providing less accurate locations in order to save power.

remarks.para: A quality constant indicating a location provider may choose to satisfy this request by providing less accurate locations in order to save power. Each location provider may interpret this field differently, but as an example, the network provider may choose to return cell based locations rather than wifi based locations in order to save power when this flag is present.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
